metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3819 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel in the function hid_debug_events_read() in drivers/hid/hid-debug.c file which may enter an infinite loop with certain parameters passed from a userspace. A local privileged user ("root") can cause a system lock up and a denial of service. Versions from v4.18 and newer are vulnerable. Vladis Dronov discovered that the debug interface for the Linux kernel's HID subsystem did not properly validate passed parameters in some situations. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (infinite loop).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3819` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1040-aws - 4.4.0-1040.43
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-144-lowlatency - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-144.170~14.04.1

notes.Note: sbeattie> claims to be introduced by fix for CVE-2018-9516 tyhicks> HID debug events are exposed via debugfs which is only accessible by the root user in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1040.43').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
